questions.question: What are the two novel energetic metal–organic frameworks (EMOFs) synthesized in the study?
What method was used to calculate the energy of detonation (ΔEdet) for the EMOFs?
How does the laser initiation threshold of [Pb(OH-Tz)2]n compare to [Pb(OH-Tz)(NO3)]n?
questions.answer: Both EMOFs have a laser initiation threshold of less than 7 mJ, but [Pb(OH-Tz)(NO3)]n responds more rapidly to the laser.

questions.question: Is the oxygen balance of [Pb(OH-Tz)2]n positive or negative, and how does it compare to [Pb(OH-Tz)(NO3)]n?
questions.answer: The oxygen balance of [Pb(OH-Tz)2]n is negative (-16.97 %), while [Pb(OH-Tz)(NO3)]n shows a positive oxygen balance.

questions.question: What is the impact of the oxygen balance on the detonation performance of [Pb(OH-Tz)(NO3)]n?
questions.answer: The positive oxygen balance of [Pb(OH-Tz)(NO3)]n affects its detonation performance but may serve as a high-energy additive component to improve the oxygen balance of the formula.

questions.question: True or False: The thermal stability of [Pb(OH-Tz)(NO3)]n is significantly lower than that of [Pb(OH-Tz)2]n due to the presence of nitrate.
What is the role of the coordination bond network in the EMOFs' structures?
questions.answer: The coordination bond network makes the structure of EMOFs compact, improves mechanical stability, and contributes to higher energy density and energy release level.

questions.question: True or False: The detonation velocity of [Pb(OH-Tz)2]n is equivalent to those of RDX and HMX.
What experimental techniques were used to confirm the consistency between the prepared powder samples and single crystal test samples?
questions.answer: Powder XRD test and element analysis using XPS methods and ICP-OES.

questions.question: True or False: The EMOFs [Pb(OH-Tz)2]n and [Pb(OH-Tz)(NO3)]n have poor laser-response performance and initiation ability.
